info.name: Task Management API
info.description:
Comprehensive API documentation for Task Management System.

## Overview
This collection contains all endpoints for managing tasks, users, and authentication.

## Base URL
`http://localhost:8000/api/v1`

## Authentication
Most endpoints require JWT token authentication. After logging in, the token will be automatically saved and used in subsequent requests.

## Getting Started
1. Register a new user via `/auth/register`
2. Login via `/auth/login` (token will be saved automatically)
3. Use other endpoints with the authenticated session

## Environment Variables
- `base_url`: API base URL (default: http://localhost:8000/api/v1)
- `access_token`: JWT token (automatically set after login)
- `user_id`: Current user ID (automatically set after login)

item.name: Authentication

request.description:
Register a new user account.

## Request Body
- `email` (string, required): Valid email address
- `username` (string, required): Unique username
- `password` (string, required): Strong password
- `full_name` (string, required): User's full name

## Response
- `201 Created`: User successfully registered
- `409 Conflict`: Email or username already exists
- `422 Unprocessable Entity`: Validation error

## Example Response
```json
{
    "success": true,
    "data": {
        "id": "uuid",
        "email": "john.doe@example.com",
        "username": "johndoe",
        "full_name": "John Doe",
        "created_at": "2024-01-30T10:00:00Z"
    },
    "message": "User registered successfully"
}
```

Login with email/username and password to obtain JWT token.

## Request Body
- `identifier` (string, required): Email or username
- `password` (string, required): User password

## Response
- `200 OK`: Login successful, returns JWT token
- `401 Unauthorized`: Invalid credentials

## Authentication
The JWT token will be automatically saved to environment variable and used in subsequent requests.

## Example Response
```json
{
    "success": true,
    "data": {
        "access_token": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9...",
        "token_type": "bearer",
        "user": {
            "id": "uuid",
            "email": "john.doe@example.com",
            "username": "johndoe",
            "full_name": "John Doe"
        }
    },
    "message": "Login successful"
}
```

Get information about the currently authenticated user.

## Authentication
Requires valid JWT token in Authorization header.

## Response
- `200 OK`: Returns current user information
- `401 Unauthorized`: Invalid or missing token

## Example Response
```json
{
    "success": true,
    "data": {
        "id": "uuid",
        "email": "john.doe@example.com",
        "username": "johndoe",
        "full_name": "John Doe",
        "created_at": "2024-01-30T10:00:00Z"
    },
    "message": "User retrieved successfully"
}
```

item.name: Users

query.description: Search by name, email, or username

request.description:
Get list of all users. Useful for assignee dropdown selection.

## Query Parameters
- `limit` (integer, optional): Items per page (default: 50, max: 100)
- `search` (string, optional): Search by name, email, or username

## Authentication
Requires valid JWT token.

## Response
- `200 OK`: Returns list of users
- `401 Unauthorized`: Invalid or missing token

## Example Response
```json
{
    "success": true,
    "data": {
        "users": [
            {
                "id": "uuid",
                "email": "john.doe@example.com",
                "username": "johndoe",
                "full_name": "John Doe",
                "created_at": "2024-01-30T10:00:00Z"
            }
        ]
    }
}
```

Search for users by name, email, or username.

## Use Case
This endpoint is particularly useful when implementing user selection dropdowns with search functionality.

## Query Parameters
- `search` (string, required): Search term to filter users
- `limit` (integer, optional): Maximum results to return

## Authentication
Requires valid JWT token.

query.description: Filter by status: todo, in_progress, done

request.description:
Get paginated list of tasks with advanced filtering and infinite scroll support.

## Query Parameters
- `limit` (integer, optional): Items per page (default: 20, max: 100)
- `cursor` (datetime, optional): Cursor for infinite scroll pagination
- `status` (enum, optional): Filter by status (todo, in_progress, done)
- `assignee_id` (UUID, optional): Filter by assignee
- `created_by_id` (UUID, optional): Filter by creator
- `search` (string, optional): Search in title and description
- `sort_order` (string, optional): Sort order (asc, desc, default: desc)

## Pagination
This endpoint uses cursor-based pagination for infinite scroll:
1. First request: Don't include cursor parameter
2. Subsequent requests: Use `next_cursor` from previous response
3. Stop when `has_more` is false

## Response
```json
{
    "success": true,
    "data": {
        "items": [
            {
                "id": "uuid",
                "title": "Task title",
                "description": "Task description",
                "status": "todo",
                "deadline": "2024-02-15T10:00:00Z",
                "assignee": {...},
                "created_by": {...},
                "created_at": "2024-01-30T10:00:00Z",
                "updated_at": "2024-01-30T10:00:00Z"
            }
        ],
        "has_more": true,
        "next_cursor": "2024-02-15T10:00:00Z"
    },
    "message": "Tasks retrieved successfully"
}
```

Get tasks filtered by status.

## Status Values
- `todo`: Tasks not yet started
- `in_progress`: Tasks currently being worked on
- `done`: Completed tasks

## Use Case
Useful for implementing kanban boards or task lists grouped by status.

Search tasks by title or description.

## Search Behavior
- Case-insensitive search
- Searches in both title and description fields
- Uses SQL ILIKE for partial matching

## Use Case
Implement search functionality in task list views.

request.description:
Create a new task.

## Request Body
- `title` (string, required): Task title
- `description` (string, optional): Task description
- `status` (enum, required): Initial status (todo, in_progress, done)
- `deadline` (datetime, required): Task deadline in ISO 8601 format
- `assignee_id` (UUID, required): User ID to assign the task to

## Validation
- Assignee must exist in the system
- Deadline must be a valid ISO 8601 datetime
- Status must be one of: todo, in_progress, done

## Response
- `201 Created`: Task created successfully
- `404 Not Found`: Assignee not found
- `422 Unprocessable Entity`: Validation error

## Example Response
```json
{
    "success": true,
    "data": {
        "id": "uuid",
        "title": "Prepare Q1 Financial Report",
        "description": "Compile and analyze Q1 financial data...",
        "status": "todo",
        "deadline": "2024-02-15T17:00:00Z",
        "assignee": {...},
        "created_by": {...},
        "created_at": "2024-01-30T10:00:00Z",
        "updated_at": "2024-01-30T10:00:00Z"
    },
    "message": "Task created successfully"
}
```

Update the status of an existing task.

## Path Parameters
- `task_id` (UUID, required): ID of the task to update

## Request Body
- `status` (enum, required): New status (todo, in_progress, done)

## Authorization
Only the task creator or assignee can update the task status.

## Response
- `200 OK`: Status updated successfully
- `403 Forbidden`: Not authorized to update this task
- `404 Not Found`: Task not found

## Use Case
Update task status as work progresses (e.g., from todo → in_progress → done).

## Example Response
```json
{
    "success": true,
    "data": {
        "id": "uuid",
        "title": "Task title",
        "status": "in_progress",
        "updated_at": "2024-01-30T11:00:00Z"
    },
    "message": "Task status updated successfully"
}
```

Delete a task permanently.

## Path Parameters
- `task_id` (UUID, required): ID of the task to delete

## Authorization
Only the task creator or assignee can delete the task.

## Response
- `200 OK`: Task deleted successfully
- `403 Forbidden`: Not authorized to delete this task
- `404 Not Found`: Task not found

## Warning
This action is permanent and cannot be undone.

## Example Response
```json
{
    "success": true,
    "data": {},
    "message": "Task deleted successfully"
}
```

Get aggregated statistics for all tasks.

## Response Data
- `total`: Total number of tasks
- `todo`: Number of tasks with status 'todo'
- `in_progress`: Number of tasks with status 'in_progress'
- `done`: Number of tasks with status 'done'

## Use Case
Display dashboard statistics showing task distribution across different statuses.

## Example Response
```json
{
    "success": true,
    "data": {
        "total": 45,
        "todo": 15,
        "in_progress": 20,
        "done": 10
    },
    "message": "Statistics retrieved successfully"
}
```

## Visualization Ideas
- Pie chart showing status distribution
- Progress bar showing completion percentage
- Summary cards for each status
- Trend analysis over time
